'Hey, Sho?'%K%P
'What's up, Mai-chan?'%K%P
'I saw this thing on TV the other day. Sometimes\npeople who are really close go from being\nfriends to being a couple.'%K%P
'Do you think we could be a couple someday?'%K%P
'Hm, I dunno. A couple's like a mom and a dad,\nright? Could we really become like that?'%K%P
'Aw, you don't want to?'%K%P
'Th-That's not it! Uh, how 'bout this?'%K%P
'When I'm grown up, and big and strong enough to\ntake care of you--'%K%P
A few days had passed since Sho started running\naround trying to restore Akane's motivation.%K%P
'Good! That's great, Akane!'%K%P
'Right? And just get a load of this!'%K%P
'Akane, I think something like this would work\nbetter there.'%K%P
As usual, Sho and Inori were in the courtyard\ncoaching Akane on her dance routine.%K%P
'You think so?'%K%P
'Yes. You see, this will be a little more\nshowy...'%K%P
From my hidden vantage point I heaved a sigh.%K%P
Sho had thrown himself wholeheartedly into\nhelping out Akane.%K%P
I couldn't tell how Akane felt, but she did seem\nto be taking all this training seriously.%K%P
And Inori was always there to lend a hand.%K%P
As for me... It didn't feel like I was doing a\nlot.%K%P
Of course, I said I wanted to save this building\nand that I'd do anything I could to help.%K%P
But none of it felt real.%K%P
'What can I do...?'%K%P
I was at a loss.%K%P
I'd been putting up a front for so long. I\ndidn't even know how I truly felt anymore.%K%P
'What do I want, really...?'%K%P
Did I want to save Tsubaki Apartments, or just\nlet it go?%K%P
I muttered to myself softly so that no one else\ncould hear.%K%P
'You're going to see your boss?'%K%P
'Yes. I received a call from her asking both\nAkane and I to come discuss matters in person.'%K%P
It wasn't until morning practice was over and\nwe'd finished lunch, that Inori brought it up.%K%P
'Sounds boooring, do I really have to go?'%K%P
'Yes, you do. It may be boring, but it's also\nimportant.'%K%P
'Fine, fine, I'll go, I'll go.'%K%P
'Once is enough. In any case... Sho, Maika?'%K%P
'I'm afraid Akane and I will be leaving now.'%K%P
'What?!'%K%P
'Huh? Something wrong, Maika?'%K%P
'Oh, uh, it's nothing... So you're leaving me\nalone with Sho?'%K%P
She muttered something under her breath, but I\nlet it go.%K%P
'Will you be staying for dinner?'%K%P
'I'm not sure. We could be back by evening... If\nnothing goes wrong, that is.'%K%P
'Why are you looking at me? Are you suggesting\nI'll do something to mess it up?!'%K%P
'Yes, something like flying off the handle at\nour boss...'%K%P
'You get angry way more than I do.'%K%P
'Did you say something?'%K%P
'No, nothing...'%K%P
'This being the case, we may be away overnight.'%K%P
'Urgh, this sucks! I want to eat Maika's\ncooking!'%K%P
Akane began to sulk.%K%P
'How about we make something you can reheat when\nyou get back?'%K%P
'Oh, thank you. That would be great.'%K%P
'If you truly want to get home early, be sure to\ntake this meeting seriously.'%K%P
'Urrrgh... Okay, fine.'%K%P
With a reluctant nod, Akane followed after Inori\nand they both left the building.%K%P
With the two of them gone, it seemed awfully\nquiet.%K%P
They'd been here so long the place felt empty\nwithout them.%K%P
'What should we make for dinner...? How about\ncurry!'%K%P
'Maika?'%K%P
'Huh? What?'%K%P
'What about dinner? We need to make something\nthat's easy to reheat.'%K%P
'Anything's good, right? Why would we need to\nreheat it?'%K%P
'Were you even listening to Inori?'%K%P
'Oh... Yeah, sorry. I was just...thinking.'%K%P
'Something on your mind? Do you want to talk\nabout it?'%K%P
'N-No, it's nothing serious. I'm fine, really.'%K%P
She didn't sound fine. She'd been acting strange\nfor a little while now.%K%P
'So, what was the problem about Inori?'%K%P
'She and Akane have to meet with their boss,\nthey might be home late. So I thought we'd make\ndinner for when they get back.'%K%P
'Okay, sounds good.'%K%P
Maika still sounded distracted, like her mind\nwas somewhere else.%K%P
'You sure you're all right? You can go take a\nnap or something if you like.'%K%P
'I'm fine. Besides, I've got chores to take care\nof.'%K%P
'Let me help you with that, then.'%K%P
Maika had already got up and was halfway to the\ndoor.%K%P
'It's okay. You should rest. You must be tired\nfrom helping Akane with her practice every day.'%K%P
'There's no way I can relax at a time like this.\nBesides, the housework'll get done faster with\ntwo of us, right?'%K%P
'I guess...'%K%P
'Then it's settled. I'll wash up the breakfast\nstuff if you can handle things out here. Sound\ngood?'%K%P
'Sure.'%K%P
'Great. Let's get started.'%K%P
I flexed my arms a little and headed for the\nkitchen.%K%P
When I finished up in there, I went looking for\nMaika to see if she needed help with anything\nelse.%K%P
There was something odd about her today.%K%P
'She seemed fine at breakfast, but now... Is she\nsick or something?'%K%P
I had no idea.%K%P
Asking her directly wouldn't get me anywhere. It\nstill bothered me, though.%K%P
'Oh, here you are.'%K%P
'You're done already? That was fast.'%K%P
'There wasn't that much to do. Looks like you're\nalmost finished, too.'%K%P
'Yeah, almost. You can head on ba--'%K%P
'No, I can still work. Here, give me a cloth.'%K%P
'Okay...'%K%P
I took one of Maika's spare cleaning cloths and\nstood next to her, wiping down any areas she'd\nmissed.%K%P
'I guess you can't reach up here, huh?'%K%P
'Yeah, but...you really don't have to help like\nthis, you know.'%K%P
'I want to. I've been spending so much time with\nAkane and Inori lately, it's nice to be able to\ndo something for you.'%K%P
'Oh really? And what would you do for me?'%K%P
'For you, anything!'%K%P
'Jeez, enough with the cheesy lines.'%K%P
Maika smiled.%K%P
She was acting a little more like herself now.%K%P
'This is...kinda strange, huh?'%K%P
'What is?'%K%P
'It's been a while since you and I have been\nalone together.'%K%P
'Up until a while ago it was always just the two\nof us here, but now it feels weird without Akane\nand Inori around.'%K%P
'I'm not saying it's a bad thing. Just...'%K%P
'Just...?'%K%P
'Forget it. It's nothing.'%K%P
What had she been trying to say?%K%P
I could only guess she was struggling with\nsomething she couldn't put into words.%K%P
'Hey Maika. Are you sure you're okay?'%K%P
'Of course I am. Why wouldn't I be?'%K%P
'You're lying.'%K%P
I looked straight into Maika's eyes.%K%P
'What makes you say that?'%K%P
She turned away to avoid my gaze. But I knew.%K%P
'How long have we known each other? By now I can\nat least tell when you're not being honest.'%K%P
She didn't say a word.%K%P
But in a way, that silence was answer enough for\nme.%K%P
'You know I'll do anything I can to help,\nright?'%K%P
'Thanks. But really, it's nothing.'%K%P
'If you say so...'%K%P
It wouldn't do any good to try to pressure Maika\ninto saying more.%K%P
I knew that, but I still wished I could do\nsomething.%K%P
'This isn't something I can tell you...'%K%P
'What was that?'%K%P
'I said enough chatter! If you're gonna work,\nthen get to work!'%K%P
'Yes ma'am!'%K%P
Maika's expression was a perfect mask. It could\nhave meant anything.%K%P
I'd just have to wait until she was ready to\ntalk.%K%P
